column4: hello, can anyone help me with ssh? i cant manage to tunnel the ports channel 2: open failed: connect failed: Connection refused
can you ssh into that remote box?
im using ssh -f user@personal-server.com -L 2000:personal-server.com:25 -N , i found this command over a guide, port, user, and host are written good, so i wonder if im right using this command
nop, thats the example, i have changed that to what i need
it ask me for key auth, and password. so it logs in, but at the time to use the application, vino, localhost:5900 says that error, channel 2: open failed: connect failed: Connection refused
Try this -> don't use the -N and -f options, only using the -L option. This'll leave you with ssh user@personal-server.com -L 2000:personal-server.com:25
channel 3: open failed: connect failed: Connection refused, samething but different channel
what did you adjust the ports to and how are you trying to port forward?
ssh user@personal-server.com -L 5900:personal-server.com:5900 then when i use remotedesktop viewer i input localhost:5900
i do hope you're changin personal-server.com into your host twice?
ssh user@host -L 5900:host:5900 like this ? i am
yes. Are you sure that whichever application you're trying to access is running on the remote host?
confirmed, app running, and the ssh give me same msg: channel 3: open failed: connect failed: Connection refused
shouldn't have to. Seems to be a server side issue, not really with SSH. I'm afraid won't be of much help.
